sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2} and B = {2, 3}. Find the values of (A △ B) x B and A x (B △ A), where △ denotes the symmetric difference between two sets and x denotes the Cartesian product. Show that (A △ B) x B is not equal to A x (B △ A), thus proving that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to the Cartesian product.
